body.p:
South carrolton Kentucky
July the 14th 1864
To all For the Information of all persons that may Be concerned

On the 17 day of novr. 1863 Thos. E. Bramlett governor of this commonwealth authorized me to Raise a Regt. of State guards and acordingly commissioned and as, col, of Said organization I comenced, Recruiting and on the 19th day of december I was orderd to disband my Recruits which order I obeyed

again on the 15th day of may I was orderd By his Excellency to Raise a Battallion of Soldiers for the purpose of Supressing Guerillars In Southern Kentucky official Instructions to Impress horses to Mount my Battallion on untill the quarter master of this State could furnish horses and horse Equipments for me I am all so ordered to give vouchers to all persons that I Impress property from
By appointing twoo disinterested men to value Said property which I will Take a pleasure In dooing at any Time when called on By the owners of property

I am further orderd that when any disafected Rebels are guilty of using any language that Is calculated to hinder or discourage my organization that I Sall Imedially arrest all persons So violating those orders and Send them 6th State guard. General Head quarters to Be tried, for treason Before a general court martial

all of which I will obey Respectfully
Sebastian C. Vick
Col Comd,g, 1st Regt Southern Kentucky
State guards
